docs.abstract: G.M. is looking for ways to cut costs, while the union hopes to reopen a factory in Lordstown, Ohio. The contract expires at 11:59 tonight.
docs.snippet: G.M. is looking for ways to cut costs, while the union hopes to reopen a factory in Lordstown, Ohio. The contract expires at 11:59 tonight.
docs.lead_paragraph: General Motors and the United Automobile Workers were working Saturday to hammer out a new labor agreement in the final hours before their current contract expires.

headline.main: G.M. and Autoworkers in Talks on New Labor Contract
headline.print_headline: G.M. and Autoworkers Union Hold Talks for New Contract

docs.abstract: The streaming giant regained some footing after losing U.S. subscribers this year. But new rivals will make it tough for that growth to continue.
docs.snippet: The streaming giant regained some footing after losing U.S. subscribers this year. But new rivals will make it tough for that growth to continue.
docs.lead_paragraph: Netflix has stemmed the bleeding. The streaming juggernaut overcame its rare moment of weakness from last quarter to add 6.8 million new customers this quarter, the company reported on Wednesday, with 520,000 of them in the United States.

headline.print_headline: ‘Stranger Things’ Helps Netflix Rebound in Third Quarter

docs.abstract: A legal provision that protects companies like Facebook and YouTube has come under criticism from lawmakers. But they have shown little appetite to repeal the law.
docs.snippet: A legal provision that protects companies like Facebook and YouTube has come under criticism from lawmakers. But they have shown little appetite to repeal the law.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Lawmakers on Wednesday criticized the Trump administration’s decision to include legal protections for Facebook, YouTube and other platforms in recent global trade deals, while raising questions about whether to modify a federal law that shields those companies at home.

headline.main: Lawmakers Blast Administration for Tech Shield in Trade Deals
headline.print_headline: Plan to Shield Tech Draws Ire of Congress

docs.abstract: The streaming giant had been hush-hush about how many people watch its original content. Until now.
docs.snippet: The streaming giant had been hush-hush about how many people watch its original content. Until now.
docs.lead_paragraph: Earlier this year, Netflix started doing something it had not done since it began streaming shows of its own in 2012: disclosing viewership figures for its original series and movies.

headline.main: Netflix’s Top 10 Original Movies and TV Shows, According to Netflix
headline.print_headline: Netflix Offers Rare Peek Into Who Is Watching What

docs.abstract: More than a dozen counties could lose electricity as the struggling utility tries to keep its equipment from sparking wildfires.
docs.snippet: More than a dozen counties could lose electricity as the struggling utility tries to keep its equipment from sparking wildfires.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pacific Gas & Electric warned that it was likely to cut power temporarily to almost 200,000 customers in Northern California by Wednesday night, the second pre-emptive blackout in two weeks.

headline.main: PG&E Warns It Could Cut Power to California Users Again
headline.print_headline: Under Fire Threat, Utility Warns  It May Again Go Dark in California

docs.abstract: Tuesday’s event drew an audience significantly smaller than the one for last month’s candidate forum in Houston.
docs.snippet: Tuesday’s event drew an audience significantly smaller than the one for last month’s candidate forum in Houston.
docs.lead_paragraph: WESTERVILLE, Ohio — The Democratic debate stage is getting bigger, but television ratings are getting smaller.

headline.main: 8.3 Million Watched Ohio Democratic Debate on Television
headline.print_headline: Ratings Show Sizable Drop In Viewership For Debate

docs.abstract: Turnover is high, unemployment low. So the chain is offering to pay full tuition costs for some business and technology programs.
docs.snippet: Turnover is high, unemployment low. So the chain is offering to pay full tuition costs for some business and technology programs.
docs.lead_paragraph: As fast-food companies across the United States struggle to recruit and retain low-wage workers, Chipotle Mexican Grill said this week that it would offer a new benefit designed to keep employees at the chain longer: free tuition at a group of colleges and universities.

headline.main: Chipotle Has a Plan to Pay Tuition. Will it Actually Help?

docs.abstract: With podcasts rising in popularity, it’s no surprise that companies are producing their own. What’s more surprising is that people are actually listening to them.
docs.snippet: With podcasts rising in popularity, it’s no surprise that companies are producing their own. What’s more surprising is that people are actually listening to them.
docs.lead_paragraph: The hit podcast “Serial” was the audio investigation that launched a thousand true-crime dramas, inspiring podcasters across the country to attempt ambitious reporting projects with gritty subject matter. There were “Dirty John” and “Hollywood & Crime,” “Death in Ice Valley” and “Atlanta Monster.”

headline.main: Welcome to McDonald’s. Would You Like a Podcast With That?

docs.abstract: Macy’s, which operates more than 600 department stores, follows brands like Michael Kors and Gucci in stopping sales of fur products.
docs.snippet: Macy’s, which operates more than 600 department stores, follows brands like Michael Kors and Gucci in stopping sales of fur products.

headline.main: Macy’s, Home to $8,000 Mink Jackets, Will Stop Selling Fur Products by 2021

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Humane Society of the United States

docs.abstract: New research shows that even if wealthy residents move away, the revenue at death from those who stay outweighs any loss in income taxes.
docs.snippet: New research shows that even if wealthy residents move away, the revenue at death from those who stay outweighs any loss in income taxes.
docs.lead_paragraph: Arkansas reaped a windfall when a Walmart founder, James L. Walton, known as Bud, died in 1995 with a fortune estimated by Forbes at $1.65 billion in today’s money. The next year, state estate tax receipts jumped 425 percent, to about $183 million in current dollars.

headline.main: Estate Tax Can Pay Off for States, Even if the Superrich Flee
headline.print_headline: States Still Love The Estate Tax Hated by Rich
